issue.title: Support non-encoded data-uris
issue.body:
Inline SVG content is a wonderful alternative to raster icons.  Less makes this very easy to do.  One little tweak would make this feature perfect.

Currently, less does uri-encoding for data-uris. For example,

`background-image: data-uri('image/svg+xml', 'myicon.svg');`

results in 

`background-image: url("data:image/svg+xml,%3C%3Fxml%20version%3D%221.0%22%20encoding%3D%22utf-8%22%3F%3E%0A%3C!--%20Generator%3A%20Adobe%20Illustrator%2018.0.0%2C%20SVG%20Export%20Plug-In%20.%20SVG%20Version%3A%206.00%20Build%200)%20%20--%3E%0A%3C!DOCTYPE%20svg%20PUBLIC%20%22-%2F%2FW3C%2F%2FDTD%20SVG%201.1%2F%2FEN%22%20%22http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2FGraphics%2FSVG%2F1.1%2FDTD%2Fsvg11.dtd%22%3E%0A%3Csvg%20version%3D%221.1%22%20id%3D%22Layer_1%22%20xmlns%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg%22%20xmlns%3Axlink%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F1999%2Fxlink%22%20x%3D%220px`...

While this works fine, it appears the URI encoding is not necessary, according to the [css 2.1 spec](http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/syndata.html#uri).  The result is difficult to read and larger than necessary, perhaps larger than the base64 encoded version. Instead, simply escape single- and double-quotes, parenthesis and whitespace.

@JonFerraiolo

body:
Compass is adding this too https://github.com/Compass/compass/issues/1460
Might have some ideas for edge cases.

issue.title: SVG Gradients compile incorrectly
issue.body:
From the reference: http://lesscss.org/functions/#misc-functions-svg-gradient

```
background-image: svg-gradient(to right, red, green 30%, blue);
```

Should compile to:

```
background-image: url('data:image/svg+xml;base64,')
```

Instead, I end up with this:

```
background-image: url('data:image/svg+xml,%3C%3Fxml%20version%3D%221.0%22%20%3F%3E%3Csvg%20xmlns%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg%22%20version%3D%221.1%22%20width%3D%22100%25%22%20height%3D%22100%25%22%20viewBox%3D%220%200%201%201%22%20preserveAspectRatio%3D%22none%22%3E%3ClinearGradient%20id%3D%22gradient%22%20gradientUnits%3D%22userSpaceOnUse%22%20x1%3D%220%25%22%20y1%3D%220%25%22%20x2%3D%22100%25%22%20y2%3D%220%25%22%3E%3Cstop%20offset%3D%220%25%22%20stop-color%3D%22%23ff0000%22%2F%3E%3Cstop%20offset%3D%2230%25%22%20stop-color%3D%22%23008000%22%2F%3E%3Cstop%20offset%3D%22100%25%22%20stop-color%3D%22%230000ff%22%2F%3E%3C%2FlinearGradient%3E%3Crect%20x%3D%220%22%20y%3D%220%22%20width%3D%221%22%20height%3D%221%22%20fill%3D%22url(%23gradient)%22%20%2F%3E%3C%2Fsvg%3E');
```

Any idea what could be causing this?
Using: lessc 2.4.0 (Less Compiler) [JavaScript]

body: Nope: CanIuse.com confirms IE must have base64 encoding, so that must be the default: http://caniuse.com/#feat=datauri  (Known issues)
The commit should probably be reverted to base64 by default for SVG.

@matthew-dean try it first - http://dbushell.com/demos/svg/utf8uri/test2.html
as long as it is url-encoded, it works. non-url-encoded does not work in IE, thats true, but less url encodes..

issue.title: data-url function breaks when upgrading from less@2.1.2 to less 2.0.0 or greater
[Feature Proposal] Better-optimized SVG encoding than URL-encoding and base64
issue.body:
I just came across this article which is relevant to Less w/ data-uri encoding: https://codepen.io/tigt/post/optimizing-svgs-in-data-uris

Basically, there was a discussion in the past about base64 vs. URL encoding for SVGs. (See: #2250 and #2184)  There are a few additional optimizations in URL encoding that can make the encoding even smaller, as discovered by the research on that article. This is an improvement since URL-encoding by itself can inflate the output greater than base64 encoding.
